2 MC-CBA adopted of Tan Binh and Thu Duc District has brought more benefits to employees than the provisions of the Labor Law: (1). For MC-CBA of Tan Binh: There are 11 benefits better than the law will be provided for the workers as follows: 1. Increase regional minimum wage at the level of at least 6.2% higher than the regional minimum wage set in Government decree annually. 2. Cover 100% of the cost of vocational training to improve workers' technical skills. 3. Shift meal (17,000 VND for food cost only). 4. Inform workers about Tet holiday plan for about 2 months in advance so that workers can plan their travels accordingly. 5. Renew labour contract for female pregnant workers. 6. Provide one more day off fully paid during Tet holiday for workers who have been working for the company for 10 years. 7. Wage during work suspension due to lack of orders, natural disaster, fire, the epidemic will be paid at 110% of the regional minimum wage. 8. Organize some tourism trips for workers during the year. 9. Thirteen-month wage bonus. 10. Bonus for workers who have initiatives to improve production. 11. Provide workers with 8 hours fully paid to participate in TU training.
(2). For MC-CBA of Thu Duc: There are 10 benefits better than the law will be provided for the workers as follows: 1. Rewarding the 13th-month salary for employees. 2. Wage for employees at the enterprises is at least 6% higher than the regional minimum wage prescribed by the Government's Decree. 3. The difference between the two adjacent wage grades is at least 6%. 4. Have a policy to reward employees’ initiatives which help increase productivity: Every six months, the enterprises shall increase wages and raise wage grades ahead of time for employees who have outstanding achievements and create benefits for the enterprises. The reward amount is at least equal to 5% of the value of the profits earned from such improvement or initiative. 5. Organization of sightseeing and tourism activities to improve the mental life of workers. 6. Allowance for meals between shifts with food value of no less than VND 17,000/person. 7. Organize periodical health checks for employees; plus gynecological examination for female workers. 8. Announce the Lunar New Year Holiday Schedule to employees no later than 02 months before the Tet holiday. 9. Entitled employees who work for 10 years or more are to one additional day off for the annual Lunar New Year holiday. 10. Allow employees to join improving knowledge sessions organized by district FoL with full pay during that period.

Total from TU and Managements = 456 (Male= 269 and Female=347) from 2 Capacity Building Event: (1). On 9 September 2020, Online training on “Negotiation Skills in Industrial Relations” organized by VITAS HCM and CNVI. Total Participant = 262 (M=81 and F=181) In the framework of cooperation between CNVI and the Vietnam Textile and Apparel Association (VITAS) - Ho Chi Minh Branch, the two organizations co-organized an online training on Zoom platform on “Negotiation Skills in Industrial Relations” for the first time. The objective of this training was to equip enterprises with the knowledge and skills to organize a constructive dialogue between employers and employees on the basis of active listening, to understand the visions and interests of each other, towards the win-win situation. In the morning session, guest speakers from VITAS, Vietnam Textile and Garment Trade Union and CNVI provided useful information on Vietnamese Labour Code 2019, EVFTA, examples of MC CBA in the textile industry in Vietnam; while negotiation and bargaining skills were delivered by professional trainers from Dutch Employers’ Cooperation Programme (DECP) in the afternoon session. Participants were textile enterprises that were members of VITAS. The total number of participants was up to 262 participants including 55 factory level TU officers from 104 textile enterprises nationwide and 3 other organizations including IDH, LIGHT and the Council of Women Entrepreneurs (VCCI HCMC).
(2). On 24 September 2020, the 2nd training for taskforce in Hung Yen City. Total Participant = 50 (M=24, F=26) This is the second training for taskforce in Hung Yen. This training was planned to take place in August, but it was delayed to September due to the second outbreak of COVID0-19 in Vietnam. This time, the training took place in Tien Hung Company, with the participation of 50 persons from 12 companies. After lunchtime, 7 companies stayed. The training provided task force members with knowledge of communication skills, social dialogue, and collective bargaining. They had an opportunity to listen to Ms. Hang – former president of the trade union of the industrial zone in Hai Phong – sharing her experiences in the MC-CBA process with Korean Electronics Companies. During the training, the participants had role-play exercises on negotiation for better listening skills, asking the right questions, putting yourself in someone’s shoes. However, many participants in this training did not join the first training so CNVI trainer had to spend more time talking about knowledge shared in the previous session. One the one hand, the employers still show support for the process and send quite a big number of managers to participate in the training, which is good. On the other hand, still, a few workers attended. There are also a good number of TU leaders who are also middle level or high-level managers of companies. Mr. Duong, President of Hung Yen Business Association who is also the owner of 9 companies in the group will be the decision-maker on the content of the MC-CBA. There is still a lack of trade union leadership in the group of companies who can mobilize voices of other TU leaders/workers to provide convincing arguments to Mr. Duong. Another problem is that the Provincial FoL and City FoL did not participate in the training.
